context: "Endal" is an Estonian reflexive pronoun used in the adessive case, meaning "by yourself," "on your own," or "for oneself." It indicates that someone is doing something independently or without help. The word belongs to the reflexive pronoun system where different cases are formed from the root "enda-" (oneself). In this adessive form, it specifically conveys the idea of being alone or acting on one's own initiative.
